title: Solving Social Issues Using Advanced Mathematics: Productive Failure-Based Project Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic arithmetic operations and volume concepts of geometric shapes
context.additional_context: Collaborative learning environment utilizing smartphones, featuring participatory classes centered on real-life problem-solving

learning_goals: They can express real-life social issues (e.g., spatial optimization of recycling waste separation) through mathematical modeling.
They can exploratively derive methods for calculating the volume of solids of revolution through productive failure strategies.
Learners can explain mathematical problem-solving processes and propose revisions through collaborative learning with peers.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
